thread.title: Queen reveals how big Christmas party helped her get over 'grisly' cold
thread.title_full: Queen reveals how big Christmas party helped her get over 'grisly' cold

title: Queen reveals how big Christmas party helped her get over 'grisly' cold
text:
Queen reveals how big Christmas party helped her get over 'grisly' cold Queen reveals how big Christmas party helped her get over 'grisly' cold THE Queen has told how she had to get over a “grisly” cold that laid her low over Christmas for a big party. PUBLISHED: 16:15,  32, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 GETTY The Queen told Baroness Shirley Williams how she got over a 'grisly' cold over Christmas 
She discussed her illness, which caused national concern over the festive period, with Baroness Shirley Williams when she made her a member of the Order of the Companions of Honour for services to political and public life. 
Lady Williams of Crosby, 86, the former Labour and Liberal Democrat politician, received her award from the Queen at an investiture ceremony at Buckingham Palace, and said the 90-year-old monarch was looking well after having to miss church over Christmas due to a heavy cold. Related articles REVEALED: The secret behind the Queen's recovery 
She said: “First of all I said I was delighted she was able to make this and was now better. 
"And she said well they had a big party in the palace so she had to get better, so she did get better. 
“But she did say it was that particularly grisly mixture of cold and flu which has been going around. Lots of people have had it.” Queen Elizabeth II in pictures Tue, February 14, 2017
